training_organizations.name: Massachusetts DCF Child Welfare Institute (CWI)
training_organizations.description: The Child Welfare Institute is the Massachusetts Department of Children & Families’ internal academy for training staff. It delivers a 12-week pre-service training for new social workers (on Massachusetts’ policies, clinical skills, and legal procedures) and coordinates in-service training statewide. CWI ensures that DCF personnel continually develop skills in areas such as cultural responsiveness, safety assessment, and permanency planning.

training_organizations.name: Massachusetts CASA Program
training_organizations.description: A statewide program (operated under the Massachusetts Trial Court) that manages CASA services. While CASA in MA is not as widespread as in some states, in jurisdictions where it exists, trained community volunteers are appointed to advocate for children’s best interests in care. These CASA volunteers complement the work of DCF and attorneys by providing the court with independent recommendations focused on the child.

training_organizations.name: Children’s League of Massachusetts
training_organizations.description: A coalition of non-profit agencies in Massachusetts that provide child welfare services (like group homes, foster care, and family services). The Children’s League advocates on policy issues (such as foster care improvements, staffing levels, and child safety legislation) and serves as a liaison between member agencies and DCF, ensuring that the voices of private providers and the children they serve are considered in system reforms.

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.DecentralScreen: Each county/region has own screening unit
policies.ReportAnonymous: General public (not mandated reporters) can remain anonymous
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Physical injury includes prenatal exposure to drugs (i.e. drug addiction at birth) failure to thrive, sexual exploitation, and human trafficking
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes malnourishment, inadequate clothing, inadequate shelter, medical neglect, inability to meet parental responsibilities/lack of supervision, emotional neglect, and educational neglect
policies.Exempt_OtherSpecify: Parent cannot adequately care for child solely due to a disability or limited physical condition
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: Any person paid to care for, or work with, a child in any public or private facility, home or program funded or licensed by the Commonwealth, which provides child care or residential services; Child care licensors; Child advocate; Animal control officers; Any person in charge of a medical or other pubic or private institution, school, or facility of that person's designated agent
policies.ScreenReq_OtherSpecify: Conduct criminal offender record information check; Review sex offender record information; Perform national criminal history checks; Information from child protection agencies in other states; Identity query; Information from local law enforcement; Collateral contacts; Clinical consultation; Searching online sources including social media
policies.InvestQual_OtherSpecify: Social worker license within first 9 months of employment
policies.ReportInfo_OtherSpecify: Other information required by the department
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: Identity and languages spoken by parents/caregivers; Languages spoken; Maltreatment history; The circumstances under which the person required to report first became aware of the child's injuries, abuse, maltreatment or neglect; Whatever action, if any, was taken to treat, shelter or otherwise assist the child; Child visibility in the community; Other contributing factors; Family strengths/capacities; Other key contacts; Worker safety information
policies.DefAge_VaryByTypeSpecify: Abandonment of a child under the age of 10 is considered maltreatment
policies.DefPerp_VaryByTypeSpecify: Perpetrator of sexual exploitation or human trafficking can be any person
policies.ScreenerQual_OtherSpecify: Social worker license within the first 9 months of employment
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: At least 30 hours of professional development training per year
policies.CaseManagerQual_OtherSpecify: Social workers license within the first 9 months of employment.
policies.CentralizedReporting_Specify: During business days and hours, reports are made to the regional Department; During evenings, weekends, and holidays, reports are made to the statewide hotline
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: Any person paid to care for, or work with, a child in any public or private facility, home or program funded or licensed by the Commonwealth, which provides child care or residential services; Child care licensors; Child advocate; Animal control officers; Any person in charge of a medical or other pubic or private institution, school, or facility of that person's designated agent
policies.ScreenerQual_TrainingSpecify: At least 30 hours of professional development training per year
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_VarySpecify: (1) Age, race, Tribal affiliation, disability, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, military or veteran status, and language are specified for  staff from child welfare agency and contracted child welfare provider organizations; (2) Marital status is specified for staff from child welfare agency; (3) Gender identity or expression and sexual orientation are specified   for staff from child welfare agency, contracted child welfare provider organizations, foster parents, kinship caregivers, interns, volunteers, and anyone who interacts with children and families
policies.DefMal_Harm_VaryByTypeSpecify: Definition of prenatal exposure (physical dependence upon an addictive drug at birth) requires harm
policies.InvestReq_MHEvalCases_Specify: Clinical consultation is obtained as needed
policies.ReporterTraining_OtherSpecify: All mandated reporters who are professionally licensed by the Commonwealth are required to complete training; G.L. c. 119, §51A (k)
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_OtherSpecify: Interns; Volunteers; Anyone who interacts with children and families
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: Clinical consultation is obtained as needed
policies.AltResp_EligibilityMaltreatment: Only certain types of maltreatment are eligible
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: At least 30 hours of professional development training per year
policies.AltResp_ServiceReferralOtherSpec: Referrals to community supports are not dependent upon or related to decisions about substantiation. The state includes decisions around differential response with other community support cases (e.g., request for information and referral, voluntary services, Children Requiring Assistance (CRA), and other court referrals).
policies.ExtFosterCare_Criteria_OtherSpec: Participating in a program or plan which promotes specific educational or rehabilitative programs; Participating in a program which promotes and supports the youth in fully developing and fulfilling the youth's potential to be a participating citizen of the Commonwealth
policies.ExtendedFosterCare_Age_OtherSpec: Generally up to age 22 (until 22nd birthday); The Department may continue services to young adults until 23 years of age if the individual demonstrates that without the provided services the individual will not complete an Associate's or higher degree program
